name: NYDailyNews
text:
State lawmakers are planning to reexamine de Blasio's request to borrow billions for NYC's fiscal coronavirus fallout.

The $5M de Blasio is requesting was brought down from the original $7B he asked for a month ago.
https://t.co/oInlBPnH9G

name: NYDailyNews
text:
A lottery winner hit a $4M jackpot for the second time in 3 years.

Mark Clark used a “lucky” coin his recently departed dad gave him to scratch his way to his second $4M prize.
https://t.co/7yVJYe3elA

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Welcome back NBA!

The NBA scheduled its season restart, with New Orleans in the first game of the resumed season on July 30, taking on Utah in Florida in the opener of a doubleheader.
https://t.co/FXm4amSROu

name: NYDailyNews
text:
White actors will no longer voice minority characters on "The Simpsons."

The show has drawn flak over white actor Hank Azaria voicing Southeast Asian convenience store owner Apu. In January, Azaria said he would cease playing the character.
https://t.co/QFWGWUH56m

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Oregon and Oregon State University have both decided to stop calling their annual rivalry game "Civil War."

“Changing this name is overdue as it represents a connection to a war fought to perpetuate slavery,” Oregon State's president said.
https://t.co/ZGzzL5gSIC

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: The Democratic-controlled House approves a bill to make D.C. the 51st state.

They explained why Congress should ensure that the city’s 700,000 residents have full voting rights — no longer subject to “taxation without representation."
https://t.co/8QHFh2Ejot

name: NYDailyNews
text:
The three cops in Elijah McClain's case were reassigned to desk duty.

McClain's case came under new scrutiny because of nationwide protests against racism and police brutality, leading to the reassignment of the officers previously walking the beat.
https://t.co/3c7bz0WMK2

name: NYDailyNews
text:
The "Shrek 2" and "Gnomeo & Juliet" director, Kelly Asbury, has died at 60.

The filmmaker passed away after a years-long cancer battle, his spokeswoman confirmed.

“He was one of the most admired and beloved people in the industry,” she said.
https://t.co/KvD8lqfq0k

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Alex Trebek won best game show host “Jeopardy!” took game show honors at the virtual Daytime Emmys.

At 79, Trebek continues to preside over the popular quiz show while battling pancreatic cancer. He announced he'd survived one year of treatment in March.
https://t.co/BBZuo3Nc1X

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: A co-founder of ReOpen Maryland who attended rallies and church services without a mask, has tested positive for COVID-19.

Republican Tim Walters said he’s one of ~2.5M Americans afflicted. But he won't cooperate with health officials to track it.
https://t.co/21X7d6Atn2

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @snydenydn: Former President Obama is joining an all-star line-up to mark this year’s Stonewall Day celebrations.

This year the powerful LGBTQ ally recorded a speech to celebrate all the progress achieved by activists, and to encourage the community to keep fighting.
https://t.co/3VKjB8QIwx

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: An animal-cruelty investigation uncovered an 18-month-old boy found inside a tiny dog cage.

His cage was covered in feces, urine and bugs — and surrounded by snakes, rats and mice.
https://t.co/VVE5SOlG5Q

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Milton Glaser, the man who designed the iconic "I ♥ NY" logo, has died at 91.

Glaser did the design free of charge at a time when crime and budget troubles tarred New York state’s image.
https://t.co/Yed2CiPBrZ

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: And they're back. 

American Airlines will resume booking flights to capacity in July.
https://t.co/IPaekipuvK

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: “Dick Cheney says WEAR A MASK” Liz Cheney wrote with  #RealMenWearMasks. 

Both Cheneys are conservative hawks, though their support of face masks puts them at odds with hard-core right-wingers like Trump.
https://t.co/5uZtrvenb1

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: The Facebook CEO made an abrupt change to content policy as the company’s stock tumbled.

Mark Zuckerberg, 36, will be more proactive on hate content in ads, blocking false claims, fighting voter suppression and bettering racial equality.
https://t.co/OFAYoFaF0P

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Trump says he cancelled a trip to his Bedminster golf course to enforce "LAW & ORDER,” after Jersey mandated a quarantine on visitors from hot spot areas, like Arizona — where Trump just held a rally.

Also demonstrations in D.C. have remained peaceful.
https://t.co/IdlCNrGxS0

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: A mom shares her exact memories of hearing gunshot rounds in East Harlem that grazed her 7-year-old daughter on a trip to Walmart.

Her daughter, who still thinks she was hit by fireworks, screamed, "Mom, I’m bleeding." 
@ParnellWesley @LeonardGreene write
https://t.co/TQTJONtioB

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Two pit bulls killed their 72-year-old female owner in southeast Louisiana.

The animals were still biting the victim as she bled on the ground when cops arrived.  The dogs then attacked the responding officers.
https://t.co/EHezQ9fu7s

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Thomas Edwin Blanton Jr. was the last of 3 one-time KKK members convicted in a 1963 Alabama church bombing that killed 4 black girls.

He died of natural causes at Donaldson prison near Birmingham.
https://t.co/oBGBeLIi5C

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Florida reports a latest single-day high with nearly 9,000 new coronavirus cases, as the death toll rose to 3,366.

Gov. Ron DeSantis warned bars could lose their liquor license if they didn’t comply.

Florida was one of the first to reopen amid the virus.
https://t.co/0Auc6RZRGU

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Popular rapper Huey, well-known for the 2006 hip hop song “Pop, Lock & Drop it,” has reportedly died at the age of 31 following a shooting in his home city of St. Louis.

https://t.co/W3YipTEon8

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Sharon Stone, the 62-year-old “Basic Instinct” star, said she was having difficulty coping with the death of ex-boyfriend Steve Bing after he committed suicide by jumping from his 27th-floor apartment in Century City, Calif.
https://t.co/GVjhgcjeTT

name: NYDailyNews
text:
A gunman killed two people, then died by suicide in an Illinois warehouse shooting.

Police said the shooter worked at a Bunn-O-Matic factory where he shot multiple coworkers. In addition to the two men killed, a woman was critically injured.
https://t.co/X2vjLuxbRx

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: Cuomo offers help — staff, equipment, knowledge, National Guard — to states seeing spike in coronavirus cases.

He cited "irrefutable evidence that rushed & non-scientific based reopening were a mistake” — and the “great irony" in its neg. economic impact.
https://t.co/pzBbcksvZo

name: NYDailyNews
text:
RT @NYDailyNews: NYC will close off at least 20 more blocks to cars so restaurants can set up tables in the middle of the street, not just sidewalks and parking spaces.  🍎🍴

text:

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Lori Vallow’s sister, Summer Cox Shiflet, said she could no longer believe in a “best possible outcome” after the bodies of Vallow’s kids, 17-year-old Tylee Ryan and 7-year-old JJ Vallow, were discovered on property in Idaho belonging to Vallow’s husband.
